Posts.Content: Hi Jacky, Don't be too hard on yourself, you've just had a huge op! It will get easier. I'm now 11 weeks post op, I only started driving 10 days ago, as I didn't feel able to move my arm enough or sit very comfy, 20/30 mins is enough though. And I know I've done more as the day wears on, so I'm now trying not to go to mad lol housebound as such for weeks can taste freedom! My tummy feels tight, depends how I sit/move causes problems as such, if I sit too long have to give myself time to stretch out. I felt quite sore bloated after eating, so started eating little and often, which helped, but now doesn't seem to cause as much problems, my consultant said it was because they've stretched all the muscles tendons nerves so it will feel strange, but will settle in time. I seem to have swelling that comes and goes to the side of my breast below armpit, again was a it will settle down, but it seems to get worse if I do too much, has been worse since I've started driving, so I just work in rest days, no point in going mad trying to do it all, I've been through a lot and I will now do what I can when I can, or tough! When I last spoke to my breast care nurse, she said in her experience it's nearer 12weeks to when you start feeling a normal, every one is different pace yourself, you'll get there. And yes I'm getting there, have had and still do have frustrating moments and know doubt there will be more, but hey oh, will overcome it all step by step. Try not to worry about your work, easier said than done I know, but you come under some disability thing with cancer ( I'm sure someone else on here can explain ?) and you can't be made redundant because of illness. So take it easy, don't beat yourself up, you've done well it does get easier x.
Posts.Title: DIEP recovery time

Posts.Content: Hi cbaz, No not had op yet, pre op assessment tomorrow and op booked for 27th. Having mx and recon, can't believe it really, from one small lump that's not known to spread.... I suppose in a strange way I'm grateful I had an adh lumpectomy back in august, otherwise I wouldn't of had the extra tests, and without MRI and dye the rest wouldn't of been found yet. Glad I went back to gp even though I thought paranoia was setting in....if only! Just been a long 10 weeks so far, 2more to go, then onwards and upwards!

Posts.Content: oh lovely weekend away! must of been great to leave all your troubles behind for a while. I'm sure it won't be long until you get your results now, and your next step starts, make the most of it!
Posts.Title: Waiting for results

Posts.Content: Hi kipper, i started on tamoxifen March 14, stopped for a few weeks in May when I had surgery, and have continued onwards since, the worst 4/5 weeks were awful, but I was told it can take a while for your body to adjust, things then started to settle down, from July  I then had zoladex added into the mix, after a few weeks of headaches, lack of sleep due to hot flashes, I went and saw my doc, and was started on amytripline, the headaches soon went, and the hot flashes calmed so I was getting a good nights sleep, which doc had said that the lack of sleep could of been causing the headaches as it can be a vicious circle. All through the year, my light at the end of the tunnel was my brothers wedding, and my other brothers impending arrival early November, come the end of November I was back at the docs, I' d had a major meltdown, I would of argued black was white to the death, I could feel the rage but I had no control, was scary! Took 2/3 days to come out from under my cloud. My tablets got changed, even though all the side effects from the other two were under control, and now are bearable again...I don't think any thing will be brilliant, just what makes it tolerable is good, and I feel fine in my self, no serious meltdowns as yet lol. But...my doc did say that even though it could be the tablets, it was more than likely that my year had caught up on me as she said we go through a lot,  and I just lost it, staying positive and strong for so long and after my niece was born, I'd ticked off the last thing on my list.... As yet, I have never thought of stopping tamoxifen, or the zoladex even though when I started on it I was told see how you go. Now have one more year of both, have done one ok ish so hopefully I will just continue the same, I'm hoping now every thing has levelled out, it will just continue the same. I trust my consultant, and this it what she thinks is best for me, so I don't see it as an option, just something to deal with lol and it won't be forever, and crikey the last year has flown! so hang in there if you can for a couple of months, give your body time to adjust,  big hugs x.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice needed

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, Haven't been on here for a while, dipped in and out a few times to over the years, to give and receive help and advice from my experiences,  Just had my second yearly mammogram, and received a lovely letter today, with an appointment booked in the week for further tests.....why on a Saturday!! Feel like the rug has been wipped from under me, trying to stay normal so kids don't pick up on anything, but really struggling I know it could be nothing, trying telling my head that!  I have been taking tamoxifen and zoladex for 2 years- thought that was supposed to help.... Everything was lovely yesterday.....
Posts.Title: 2 years - mammogram - received letter for tests

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  Thanks for all your lovely comments, helped put things back into perspective, think I have sorted my boxes in my head, from the shock at the weekend,  Shame I'm now full of cold!! But the spiky throat has finally gone,  ......and tomorrow, I will deal with it as it happens, but fingers crossed x
Posts.Title: 2 years - mammogram - received letter for tests

Posts.Content: your allowed off days, we all go through it, it does get easier, and you will get through it! You have nothing to be embarrassed about, it's a horrible disease, but with support from your family you'll all get through it, just be honest with how you feel, we all get gut feelings and can sense when we aren't getting the whole story, that can set minds wandering down roads far worse than reality, and that will not help any one. i bought my daughter a new TV for her room when I was diagnosed, So if she wanted to she could have her own space away, she didn't want it, it stayed in the box for a few days until I finally got to the bottom of it...she thought it was a leaving gift!! - where that came from who knows, but from then, she has read notes from hospital, so she knows, that she knows the truth, and I know she's not worrying herself stupid. I guess what I'm trying to say is, however hard you try to protect them they are on the journey too already, and will want to be there for you. hopefully tomorrow wI'll be a better one  big hugs x
Posts.Title: I can no longer cope

Posts.Content: Hi Cbaz, Just noticed you are going through this at the same time also...good luck to, hopefully your op date is not too far away. Keep me updated..we can all compare and help each other x.

Only had a adh lump removed 6/7 months ago.  Hope all goes well with your op, please let me know how you get on, x.

I didn't expect to back quite so soon. Not looking forward to any of it, but will dig deep...just can remember how sore I felt last time, so expecting it to be worse..so roll on end of june, guessing by then it will all be over with and I'll be feeling more like myself.  How many weeks of radiotherapy are you having? I'm looking at 3 weeks, and an hour and half round trip too....but whatever it takes!!
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: I had an adh lump removed from the same breast end of aug, and as I was back so soon, my consultant just wanted to make sure there was nothing else, other than the lump I could occasionally feel which had just been diagnosed as tubular cancer. none of this has shown on mammogram! The areas shown on the mri, tried yesterday to get a biopsy with ultrasound but couldn't find them, two Dr's tried but weren't convinced of any suspicious areas, but did agree on another possible area. If this is positive then it's a masectomy, if not I have to have an mri guided biopsy on the suspicious areas, if this is positive then again masectomy. Hoping for original plan! but feel the odds are stacked.  If I end up with a masectomy, I will be 65 miles from home for a week, thats awful!!! on top of every thing else, in 15 years of marriage only ever spent half a dozen or so nights apart, and thats only been one night in a year across the years, and he was on courses for work, let alone my kids 13 and 11.  Part of me wants it over as soon as poss, but easter is only in two weeks, would now be nice to spend some family time before it all starts, get results next week, following week is easter, so can't believe one extra week will make much difference, and if I'm stuck from home over bank holiday weekend hardly going to help my head! But of course will listen to consultant, whatever is best for me in the long run, but would be nice thats all. x

Posts.Content: Hi mis sally, I was diagnosed in march too, but I'm still waiting on yet more results, you must be so relieved having your op so it's gone. what op did you have? were you nodes clear? what grade was yours? how much radio therapy are you going to be having? sorry for all the questions, my original plan is wle with dye and couple of nodes and 3weeks radiotherapy, whether it's that any more? don't think so but hoping! Good luck with the radiotherapy, your nearly there!

Posts.Content: Hi Lynnee, Keep thinking positive thoughts! It's hard I know, especially when your just waiting, like me, you just need to know what  your up against!? Posts.Title: anyone out there diagnosed with tubular cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi,  Have any of you tried taking any tablets to help with the side effects? I have been on zoladex and tamoxifen for nearly 2 years now, and gp has prescribed clonidine to help, which has helped make things more manageable, a now manage a good nights sleep... Most nights even through the summer! I still feel hot from time to time, but it is so much better than it was.  It may help you too??
Posts.Title: Too Many Hot Flushes

Posts.Content: Hi, I had an adh lump removed 6 months ago, I had nearly 4 weeks off from work, but my job includes some lifting. and took me 5 weeks until I dared drive because of the seat belt, After 2 weeks went for a short car journey, worst thing I could of done, felt really sore for 3-4 days and was back on the paracetemol.  Now due to have dye assisted surgery to remove another lump and a few nodes, as I was diagnosed with tubular bc last week. Waiting for wednesday to hopefully get a date for op, as had to have an mri first. Will definately take it easier this time round, and not push myself so much to get on with life, as I think this op will take a bit longer to recover from. Just do what you are able to, nothing is that urgent that you have to struggle, will only lengthen your recovery.
